subject: Psychology
title: Melatonin and Darkness
description: A quick win: understand Melatonin and Darkness.

hook.text: As the sun sets, your brain quietly releases a hormone that whispers: it's time to sleep. Darkness is the trigger.

buildup.text: Melatonin is produced by the pineal gland in response to darkness. It signals the body that nighttime has arrived.

discovery.text: Melatonin doesn't cause sleep directly. It signals timing â€” telling your body when to prepare for sleep.

twist.text: Evening screen light suppresses melatonin production by up to 50%, pushing your internal bedtime later and later.

climax.text: Melatonin supplements are popular but often misused. They help with timing issues, not with the ability to sleep.

punchline.text: Melatonin doesn't make you sleep. It tells your body when to.

quiz.question: What triggers melatonin production?
options: Darkness signals to the pineal gland
